tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE vehicle_maintenance_alerts (
    alert_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    vehicle_id INT NOT NULL,
    alert_type VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    alert_message TEXT,
    alert_datetime TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE vehicle_alerts (
    alert_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    vehicle_id INT NOT NULL,
    alert_type VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
    alert_message TEXT,
    alert_date TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE vehicle_data ( 
  vehicle_id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
  vehicle_name VARCHAR(50), 
  mileage INT, 
  last_maintenance_date DATE 
)

CREATE TABLE maintenance_criteria ( 
  criteria_id INT PRIMARY KEY, 
  criteria_name VARCHAR(50), 
  maintenance_interval INT 
)

CREATE TABLE alert_logs ( 
  log_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, 
  vehicle_id INT, 
  alert_message VARCHAR(255), 
  alert_date TIMESTAMP 
)

CREATE TABLE VehicleDetails (
    id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    vehicle_id INT,
    make VARCHAR(50),
    model VARCHAR(50),
    year INT,
    last_maintenance_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE VehicleMaintenance (
    maintenance_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    vehicle_id UUID,
    criteria_id UUID,
    maintenance_date date,
    CONSTRAINT fk_vehicle FOREIGN KEY (vehicle_id) REFERENCES Vehicles(vehicle_id),
    CONSTRAINT fk_criteria FOREIGN KEY (criteria_id) REFERENCES MaintenanceCriteria(criteria_id)
);

CREATE TABLE AlertLogs (
    log_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    maintenance_id UUID,
    alert_type varchar(255),
    message text,
    alert_timestamp timestamp,
    CONSTRAINT fk_maintenance FOREIGN KEY (maintenance_id) REFERENCES VehicleMaintenance(maintenance_id)
);
